segment_text: I had called upon my friend Sherlock Holmes upon the second morning after Christmas, with the intention of wishing him the compliments of the season.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was lounging upon the sofa in a purple dressing-gown, a pipe-rack within his reach upon the right, and a pile of crumpled morning papers, evidently newly studied, near at hand.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Beside the couch was a wooden chair, and on the angle of the back hung a very seedy and disreputable hard-felt hat, much the worse for wear, and cracked in several places.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: A lens and a forceps lying upon the seat of the chair suggested that the hat had been suspended in this manner for the purpose of examination.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You are engaged,” said I; “perhaps I interrupt you.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Not at all. I am glad to have a friend with whom I can discuss my results.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The matter is a perfectly trivial one”—he jerked his thumb in the direction of the old hat—“but there are points in connection with it which are not entirely devoid of interest and even of instruction.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I seated myself in his armchair and warmed my hands before his crackling fire, for a sharp frost had set in, and the windows were thick with the ice crystals.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I suppose,” I remarked, “that, homely as it looks, this thing has some deadly story linked on to it—that it is the clue which will guide you in the solution of some mystery and the punishment of some crime.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No, no. No crime,” said Sherlock Holmes, laughing.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Only one of those whimsical little incidents which will happen when you have four million human beings all jostling each other within the space of a few square miles.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Amid the action and reaction of so dense a swarm of humanity, every possible combination of events may be expected to take place, and many a little problem will be presented which may be striking and bizarre without being criminal.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: We have already had experience of such.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “So much so,” I remarked, “that of the last six cases which I have added to my notes, three have been entirely free of any legal crime.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Precisely. You allude to my attempt to recover the Irene Adler papers, to the singular case of Miss Mary Sutherland, and to the adventure of the man with the twisted lip.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Well, I have no doubt that this small matter will fall into the same innocent category. You know Peterson, the commissionaire?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is to him that this trophy belongs.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is his hat.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No, no, he found it. Its owner is unknown.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I beg that you will look upon it not as a battered billycock but as an intellectual problem. And, first, as to how it came here.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It arrived upon Christmas morning, in company with a good fat goose, which is, I have no doubt, roasting at this moment in front of Peterson’s fire.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The facts are these: about four o’clock on Christmas morning, Peterson, who, as you know, is a very honest fellow, was returning from some small jollification and was making his way homeward down Tottenham Court Road.
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: In front of him he saw, in the gaslight, a tallish man, walking with a slight stagger, and carrying a white goose slung over his shoulder.
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: As he reached the corner of Goodge Street, a row broke out between this stranger and a little knot of roughs.
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: One of the latter knocked off the man’s hat, on which he raised his stick to defend himself and, swinging it over his head, smashed the shop window behind him.
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: Peterson had rushed forward to protect the stranger from his assailants; but the man, shocked at having broken the window, and seeing an official-looking person in uniform rushing towards him, dropped his goose, took to his heels, and vanished amid the labyrinth of small streets which lie at the back of Tottenham Court Road.
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: The roughs had also fled at the appearance of Peterson, so that he was left in possession of the field of battle, and also of the spoils of victory in the shape of this battered hat and a most unimpeachable Christmas goose.”
scene_description: nighttime, London street corner, gas lamps, shopfronts

segment_text: “Which surely he restored to their owner?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “My dear fellow, there lies the problem. It is true that ‘For Mrs. Henry Baker’ was printed upon a small card which was tied to the bird’s left leg, and it is also true that the initials ‘H. B.’ are legible upon the lining of this hat, but as there are some thousands of Bakers, and some hundreds of Henry Bakers in this city of ours, it is not easy to restore lost property to any one of them.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What, then, did Peterson do?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “He brought round both hat and goose to me on Christmas morning, knowing that even the smallest problems are of interest to me.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The goose we retained until this morning, when there were signs that, in spite of the slight frost, it would be well that it should be eaten without unnecessary delay.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Its finder has carried it off, therefore, to fulfil the ultimate destiny of a goose, while I continue to retain the hat of the unknown gentleman who lost his Christmas dinner.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Did he not advertise?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Then, what clue could you have as to his identity?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Only as much as we can deduce.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “From his hat?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Precisely.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “But you are joking. What can you gather from this old battered felt?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Here is my lens. You know my methods.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: What can you gather yourself as to the individuality of the man who has worn this article?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I took the tattered object in my hands and turned it over rather ruefully.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was a very ordinary black hat of the usual round shape, hard and much the worse for wear. The lining had been of red silk, but was a good deal discoloured.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: There was no maker’s name; but, as Holmes had remarked, the initials “H. B.” were scrawled upon one side.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was pierced in the brim for a hat-securer, but the elastic was missing.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: For the rest, it was cracked, exceedingly dusty, and spotted in several places, although there seemed to have been some attempt to hide the discoloured patches by smearing them with ink.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I can see nothing,” said I, handing it back to my friend.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “On the contrary, Watson, you can see everything. You fail, however, to reason from what you see.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: You are too timid in drawing your inferences.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Then, pray tell me what it is that you can infer from this hat?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He picked it up and gazed at it in the peculiar introspective fashion which was characteristic of him.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is perhaps less suggestive than it might have been,” he remarked, “and yet there are a few inferences which are very distinct, and a few others which represent at least a strong balance of probability.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: That the man was highly intellectual is of course obvious upon the face of it, and also that he was fairly well-to-do within the last three years, although he has now fallen upon evil days.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He had foresight, but has less now than formerly, pointing to a moral retrogression, which, when taken with the decline of his fortunes, seems to indicate some evil influence, probably drink, at work upon him.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: This may account also for the obvious fact that his wife has ceased to love him.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “My dear Holmes!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “He has, however, retained some degree of self-respect,” he continued, disregarding my remonstrance.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “He is a man who leads a sedentary life, goes out little, is out of training entirely, is middle-aged, has grizzled hair which he has had cut within the last few days, and which he anoints with lime-cream.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: These are the more patent facts which are to be deduced from his hat. Also, by the way, that it is extremely improbable that he has gas laid on in his house.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You are certainly joking, Holmes.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Not in the least. Is it possible that even now, when I give you these results, you are unable to see how they are attained?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I have no doubt that I am very stupid, but I must confess that I am unable to follow you. For example, how did you deduce that this man was intellectual?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: For answer Holmes clapped the hat upon his head. It came right over the forehead and settled upon the bridge of his nose.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is a question of cubic capacity,” said he; “a man with so large a brain must have something in it.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The decline of his fortunes, then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “This hat is three years old. These flat brims curled at the edge came in then.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is a hat of the very best quality. Look at the band of ribbed silk and the excellent lining.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: If this man could afford to buy so expensive a hat three years ago, and has had no hat since, then he has assuredly gone down in the world.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, that is clear enough, certainly. But how about the foresight and the moral retrogression?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes laughed. “Here is the foresight,” said he putting his finger upon the little disc and loop of the hat-securer.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “They are never sold upon hats. If this man ordered one, it is a sign of a certain amount of foresight, since he went out of his way to take this precaution against the wind.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: But since we see that he has broken the elastic and has not troubled to replace it, it is obvious that he has less foresight now than formerly, which is a distinct proof of a weakening nature.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: On the other hand, he has endeavoured to conceal some of these stains upon the felt by daubing them with ink, which is a sign that he has not entirely lost his self-respect.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Your reasoning is certainly plausible.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The further points, that he is middle-aged, that his hair is grizzled, that it has been recently cut, and that he uses lime-cream, are all to be gathered from a close examination of the lower part of the lining.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The lens discloses a large number of hair-ends, clean cut by the scissors of the barber. They all appear to be adhesive, and there is a distinct odour of lime-cream.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: This dust, you will observe, is not the gritty, grey dust of the street but the fluffy brown dust of the house, showing that it has been hung up indoors most of the time, while the marks of moisture upon the inside are proof positive that the wearer perspired very freely, and could therefore, hardly be in the best of training.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “But his wife—you said that she had ceased to love him.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “This hat has not been brushed for weeks. When I see you, my dear Watson, with a week’s accumulation of dust upon your hat, and when your wife allows you to go out in such a state, I shall fear that you also have been unfortunate enough to lose your wife’s affection.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “But he might be a bachelor.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Nay, he was bringing home the goose as a peace-offering to his wife. Remember the card upon the bird’s leg.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “You have an answer to everything. But how on earth do you deduce that the gas is not laid on in his house?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “One tallow stain, or even two, might come by chance; but when I see no less than five, I think that there can be little doubt that the individual must be brought into frequent contact with burning tallow—walks upstairs at night probably with his hat in one hand and a guttering candle in the other.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Anyhow, he never got tallow-stains from a gas-jet. Are you satisfied?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, it is very ingenious,” said I, laughing; “but since, as you said just now, there has been no crime committed, and no harm done save the loss of a goose, all this seems to be rather a waste of energy.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes had opened his mouth to reply, when the door flew open, and Peterson, the commissionaire, rushed into the apartment with flushed cheeks and the face of a man who is dazed with astonishment.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The goose, Mr. Holmes! The goose, sir!” he gasped.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Eh? What of it, then? Has it returned to life and flapped off through the kitchen window?” Holmes twisted himself round upon the sofa to get a fairer view of the man’s excited face.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “See here, sir! See what my wife found in its crop!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He held out his hand and displayed upon the centre of the palm a brilliantly scintillating blue stone, rather smaller than a bean in size, but of such purity and radiance that it twinkled like an electric point in the dark hollow of his hand.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes sat up with a whistle. “By Jove, Peterson!” said he, “this is treasure trove indeed.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I suppose you know what you have got?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “A diamond, sir? A precious stone. It cuts into glass as though it were putty.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It’s more than a precious stone. It is _the_ precious stone.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Not the Countess of Morcar’s blue carbuncle!” I ejaculated.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Precisely so. I ought to know its size and shape, seeing that I have read the advertisement about it in _The Times_ every day lately.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It is absolutely unique, and its value can only be conjectured, but the reward offered of £ 1000 is certainly not within a twentieth part of the market price.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “A thousand pounds! Great Lord of mercy!” The commissionaire plumped down into a chair and stared from one to the other of us.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “That is the reward, and I have reason to know that there are sentimental considerations in the background which would induce the Countess to part with half her fortune if she could but recover the gem.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It was lost, if I remember aright, at the Hotel Cosmopolitan,” I remarked.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Precisely so, on December 22nd, just five days ago. John Horner, a plumber, was accused of having abstracted it from the lady’s jewel-case.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The evidence against him was so strong that the case has been referred to the Assizes. I have some account of the matter here, I believe.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He rummaged amid his newspapers, glancing over the dates, until at last he smoothed one out, doubled it over, and read the following paragraph:
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Hotel Cosmopolitan Jewel Robbery. John Horner, 26, plumber, was brought up upon the charge of having upon the 22nd inst., abstracted from the jewel-case of the Countess of Morcar the valuable gem known as the blue carbuncle.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: James Ryder, upper-attendant at the hotel, gave his evidence to the effect that he had shown Horner up to the dressing-room of the Countess of Morcar upon the day of the robbery in order that he might solder the second bar of the grate, which was loose.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He had remained with Horner some little time, but had finally been called away. On returning, he found that Horner had disappeared, that the bureau had been forced open, and that the small morocco casket in which, as it afterwards transpired, the Countess was accustomed to keep her jewel, was lying empty upon the dressing-table.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ryder instantly gave the alarm, and Horner was arrested the same evening; but the stone could not be found either upon his person or in his rooms.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Catherine Cusack, maid to the Countess, deposed to having heard Ryder’s cry of dismay on discovering the robbery, and to having rushed into the room, where she found matters as described by the last witness.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Inspector Bradstreet, B division, gave evidence as to the arrest of Horner, who struggled frantically, and protested his innocence in the strongest terms.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Evidence of a previous conviction for robbery having been given against the prisoner, the magistrate refused to deal summarily with the offence, but referred it to the Assizes. Horner, who had shown signs of intense emotion during the proceedings, fainted away at the conclusion and was carried out of court.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Hum! So much for the police-court,” said Holmes thoughtfully, tossing aside the paper.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The question for us now to solve is the sequence of events leading from a rifled jewel-case at one end to the crop of a goose in Tottenham Court Road at the other.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: You see, Watson, our little deductions have suddenly assumed a much more important and less innocent aspect.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Here is the stone; the stone came from the goose, and the goose came from Mr. Henry Baker, the gentleman with the bad hat and all the other characteristics with which I have bored you.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: So now we must set ourselves very seriously to finding this gentleman and ascertaining what part he has played in this little mystery.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: To do this, we must try the simplest means first, and these lie undoubtedly in an advertisement in all the evening papers. If this fail, I shall have recourse to other methods.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What will you say?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Give me a pencil and that slip of paper. Now, then: ‘Found at the corner of Goodge Street, a goose and a black felt hat.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Mr. Henry Baker can have the same by applying at 6:30 this evening at 221B, Baker Street.’ That is clear and concise.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Very. But will he see it?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, he is sure to keep an eye on the papers, since, to a poor man, the loss was a heavy one.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was clearly so scared by his mischance in breaking the window and by the approach of Peterson that he thought of nothing but flight, but since then he must have bitterly regretted the impulse which caused him to drop his bird.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then, again, the introduction of his name will cause him to see it, for everyone who knows him will direct his attention to it.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Here you are, Peterson, run down to the advertising agency and have this put in the evening papers.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “In which, sir?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, in the _Globe_, _Star_, _Pall Mall_, _St. James’s Gazette_, _Evening News_, _Standard_, _Echo_, and any others that occur to you.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Very well, sir. And this stone?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Ah, yes, I shall keep the stone. Thank you.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: And, I say, Peterson, just buy a goose on your way back and leave it here with me, for we must have one to give to this gentleman in place of the one which your family is now devouring.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: When the commissionaire had gone, Holmes took up the stone and held it against the light. “It’s a bonny thing,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Just see how it glints and sparkles. Of course it is a nucleus and focus of crime. Every good stone is.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: They are the devil’s pet baits. In the larger and older jewels every facet may stand for a bloody deed.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: This stone is not yet twenty years old. It was found in the banks of the Amoy River in southern China and is remarkable in having every characteristic of the carbuncle, save that it is blue in shade instead of ruby red.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: In spite of its youth, it has already a sinister history. There have been two murders, a vitriol-throwing, a suicide, and several robberies brought about for the sake of this forty-grain weight of crystallised charcoal.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Who would think that so pretty a toy would be a purveyor to the gallows and the prison? I’ll lock it up in my strong box now and drop a line to the Countess to say that we have it.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Do you think that this man Horner is innocent?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I cannot tell.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Well, then, do you imagine that this other one, Henry Baker, had anything to do with the matter?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is, I think, much more likely that Henry Baker is an absolutely innocent man, who had no idea that the bird which he was carrying was of considerably more value than if it were made of solid gold.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: That, however, I shall determine by a very simple test if we have an answer to our advertisement.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “And you can do nothing until then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Nothing.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “In that case I shall continue my professional round. But I shall come back in the evening at the hour you have mentioned, for I should like to see the solution of so tangled a business.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Very glad to see you. I dine at seven. There is a woodcock, I believe.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: By the way, in view of recent occurrences, perhaps I ought to ask Mrs. Hudson to examine its crop.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I had been delayed at a case, and it was a little after half-past six when I found myself in Baker Street once more.
scene_description: nighttime, residential street, townhouse exterior, glowing fanlight

segment_text: As I approached the house I saw a tall man in a Scotch bonnet with a coat which was buttoned up to his chin waiting outside in the bright semicircle which was thrown from the fanlight.
scene_description: nighttime, residential street, townhouse exterior, glowing fanlight

segment_text: Just as I arrived the door was opened, and we were shown up together to Holmes’ room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Mr. Henry Baker, I believe,” said he, rising from his armchair and greeting his visitor with the easy air of geniality which he could so readily assume.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Pray take this chair by the fire, Mr. Baker. It is a cold night, and I observe that your circulation is more adapted for summer than for winter.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ah, Watson, you have just come at the right time. Is that your hat, Mr. Baker?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, sir, that is undoubtedly my hat.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He was a large man with rounded shoulders, a massive head, and a broad, intelligent face, sloping down to a pointed beard of grizzled brown.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: A touch of red in nose and cheeks, with a slight tremor of his extended hand, recalled Holmes’ surmise as to his habits.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: His rusty black frock-coat was buttoned right up in front, with the collar turned up, and his lank wrists protruded from his sleeves without a sign of cuff or shirt.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He spoke in a slow staccato fashion, choosing his words with care, and gave the impression generally of a man of learning and letters who had had ill-usage at the hands of fortune.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “We have retained these things for some days,” said Holmes, “because we expected to see an advertisement from you giving your address.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I am at a loss to know now why you did not advertise.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Our visitor gave a rather shamefaced laugh. “Shillings have not been so plentiful with me as they once were,” he remarked.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I had no doubt that the gang of roughs who assaulted me had carried off both my hat and the bird. I did not care to spend more money in a hopeless attempt at recovering them.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Very naturally. By the way, about the bird, we were compelled to eat it.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “To eat it!” Our visitor half rose from his chair in his excitement.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, it would have been of no use to anyone had we not done so. But I presume that this other goose upon the sideboard, which is about the same weight and perfectly fresh, will answer your purpose equally well?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, certainly, certainly,” answered Mr. Baker with a sigh of relief.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Of course, we still have the feathers, legs, crop, and so on of your own bird, so if you wish—”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: The man burst into a hearty laugh. “They might be useful to me as relics of my adventure,” said he, “but beyond that I can hardly see what use the _disjecta membra_ of my late acquaintance are going to be to me.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: No, sir, I think that, with your permission, I will confine my attentions to the excellent bird which I perceive upon the sideboard.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes glanced sharply across at me with a slight shrug of his shoulders.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “There is your hat, then, and there your bird,” said he. “By the way, would it bore you to tell me where you got the other one from?
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I am somewhat of a fowl fancier, and I have seldom seen a better grown goose.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Certainly, sir,” said Baker, who had risen and tucked his newly gained property under his arm.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “There are a few of us who frequent the Alpha Inn, near the Museum—we are to be found in the Museum itself during the day, you understand.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: This year our good host, Windigate by name, instituted a goose club, by which, on consideration of some few pence every week, we were each to receive a bird at Christmas.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: My pence were duly paid, and the rest is familiar to you. I am much indebted to you, sir, for a Scotch bonnet is fitted neither to my years nor my gravity.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: With a comical pomposity of manner he bowed solemnly to both of us and strode off upon his way.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “So much for Mr. Henry Baker,” said Holmes when he had closed the door behind him. “It is quite certain that he knows nothing whatever about the matter.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Are you hungry, Watson?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Not particularly.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Then I suggest that we turn our dinner into a supper and follow up this clue while it is still hot.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “By all means.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It was a bitter night, so we drew on our ulsters and wrapped cravats about our throats.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Outside, the stars were shining coldly in a cloudless sky, and the breath of the passers-by blew out into smoke like so many pistol shots.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: Our footfalls rang out crisply and loudly as we swung through the doctors’ quarter, Wimpole Street, Harley Street, and so through Wigmore Street into Oxford Street.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: In a quarter of an hour we were in Bloomsbury at the Alpha Inn, which is a small public-house at the corner of one of the streets which runs down into Holborn.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: Holmes pushed open the door of the private bar and ordered two glasses of beer from the ruddy-faced, white-aproned landlord.
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Your beer should be excellent if it is as good as your geese,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “My geese!” The man seemed surprised.
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Yes. I was speaking only half an hour ago to Mr. Henry Baker, who was a member of your goose club.”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Ah! yes, I see. But you see, sir, them’s not _our_ geese.”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Indeed! Whose, then?”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Well, I got the two dozen from a salesman in Covent Garden.”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Indeed? I know some of them. Which was it?”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Breckinridge is his name.”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Ah! I don’t know him. Well, here’s your good health landlord, and prosperity to your house. Good-night.”
scene_description: indoors, pub interior, wooden bar, dim lighting

segment_text: “Now for Mr. Breckinridge,” he continued, buttoning up his coat as we came out into the frosty air.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: “Remember, Watson that though we have so homely a thing as a goose at one end of this chain, we have at the other a man who will certainly get seven years’ penal servitude unless we can establish his innocence.”
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: we can establish his innocence.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: It is possible that our inquiry may but confirm his guilt; but, in any case, we have a line of investigation which has been missed by the police, and which a singular chance has placed in our hands.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: Let us follow it out to the bitter end.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: Faces to the south, then, and quick march!”
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: We passed across Holborn, down Endell Street, and so through a zigzag of slums to Covent Garden Market.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: One of the largest stalls bore the name of Breckinridge upon it, and the proprietor a horsey-looking man, with a sharp face and trim side-whiskers was helping a boy to put up the shutters.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Good-evening. It’s a cold night,” said Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: The salesman nodded and shot a questioning glance at my companion.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Sold out of geese, I see,” continued Holmes, pointing at the bare slabs of marble.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Let you have five hundred to-morrow morning.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “That’s no good.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well, there are some on the stall with the gas-flare.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Ah, but I was recommended to you.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Who by?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “The landlord of the Alpha.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Oh, yes; I sent him a couple of dozen.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Fine birds they were, too. Now where did you get them from?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: To my surprise the question provoked a burst of anger from the salesman.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Now, then, mister,” said he, with his head cocked and his arms akimbo, “what are you driving at? Let’s have it straight, now.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “It is straight enough. I should like to know who sold you the geese which you supplied to the Alpha.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well then, I shan’t tell you. So now!”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Oh, it is a matter of no importance; but I don’t know why you should be so warm over such a trifle.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Warm! You’d be as warm, maybe, if you were as pestered as I am.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: When I pay good money for a good article there should be an end of the business; but it’s ‘Where are the geese?’ and ‘Who did you sell the geese to?’ and ‘What will you take for the geese?’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: One would think they were the only geese in the world, to hear the fuss that is made over them.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well, I have no connection with any other people who have been making inquiries,” said Holmes carelessly.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “If you won’t tell us the bet is off, that is all. But I’m always ready to back my opinion on a matter of fowls, and I have a fiver on it that the bird I ate is country bred.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well, then, you’ve lost your fiver, for it’s town bred,” snapped the salesman.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “It’s nothing of the kind.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I say it is.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I don’t believe it.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “D’you think you know more about fowls than I, who have handled them ever since I was a nipper? I tell you, all those birds that went to the Alpha were town bred.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “You’ll never persuade me to believe that.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Will you bet, then?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “It’s merely taking your money, for I know that I am right. But I’ll have a sovereign on with you, just to teach you not to be obstinate.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: The salesman chuckled grimly.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Bring me the books, Bill,” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: The small boy brought round a small thin volume and a great greasy-backed one, laying them out together beneath the hanging lamp.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Now then, Mr. Cocksure,” said the salesman, “I thought that I was out of geese, but before I finish you’ll find that there is still one left in my shop.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: You see this little book?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “That’s the list of the folk from whom I buy. D’you see?
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Well, then, here on this page are the country folk, and the numbers after their names are where their accounts are in the big ledger.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Now, then! You see this other page in red ink?
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Well, that is a list of my town suppliers. Now, look at that third name.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Just read it out to me.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Mrs. Oakshott, 117, Brixton Road—249,” read Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Quite so. Now turn that up in the ledger.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Holmes turned to the page indicated.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Here you are, ‘Mrs. Oakshott, 117, Brixton Road, egg and poultry supplier.’”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Now, then, what’s the last entry?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “‘December 22nd. Twenty-four geese at 7_s_. 6_d_.’”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Quite so. There you are.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: And underneath?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “‘Sold to Mr. Windigate of the Alpha, at 12_s_.’”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “What have you to say now?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes looked deeply chagrined.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: He drew a sovereign from his pocket and threw it down upon the slab, turning away with the air of a man whose disgust is too deep for words.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: A few yards off he stopped under a lamp-post and laughed in the hearty, noiseless fashion which was peculiar to him.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “When you see a man with whiskers of that cut and the ‘Pink ’un’ protruding out of his pocket, you can always draw him by a bet,” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I daresay that if I had put £ 100 down in front of him, that man would not have given me such complete information as was drawn from him by the idea that he was doing me on a wager.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Well, Watson, we are, I fancy, nearing the end of our quest, and the only point which remains to be determined is whether we should go on to this Mrs. Oakshott to-night, or whether we should reserve it for to-morrow.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: It is clear from what that surly fellow said that there are others besides ourselves who are anxious about the matter, and I should—”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: His remarks were suddenly cut short by a loud hubbub which broke out from the stall which we had just left.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Turning round we saw a little rat-faced fellow standing in the centre of the circle of yellow light which was thrown by the swinging lamp, while Breckinridge, the salesman, framed in the door of his stall, was shaking his fists fiercely at the cringing figure.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I’ve had enough of you and your geese,” he shouted.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I wish you were all at the devil together. If you come pestering me any more with your silly talk I’ll set the dog at you.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: You bring Mrs. Oakshott here and I’ll answer her, but what have you to do with it? Did I buy the geese off you?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “No; but one of them was mine all the same,” whined the little man.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well, then, ask Mrs. Oakshott for it.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “She told me to ask you.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well, you can ask the King of Proosia, for all I care. I’ve had enough of it.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Get out of this!”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: He rushed fiercely forward, and the inquirer flitted away into the darkness.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Ha! this may save us a visit to Brixton Road,” whispered Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Come with me, and we will see what is to be made of this fellow.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Striding through the scattered knots of people who lounged round the flaring stalls, my companion speedily overtook the little man and touched him upon the shoulder.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: He sprang round, and I could see in the gas-light that every vestige of colour had been driven from his face.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Who are you, then? What do you want?” he asked in a quavering voice.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “You will excuse me,” said Holmes blandly, “but I could not help overhearing the questions which you put to the salesman just now.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: I think that I could be of assistance to you.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “You? Who are you? How could you know anything of the matter?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “My name is Sherlock Holmes. It is my business to know what other people don’t know.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “But you can know nothing of this?”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Excuse me, I know everything of it.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: You are endeavouring to trace some geese which were sold by Mrs. Oakshott, of Brixton Road, to a salesman named Breckinridge, by him in turn to Mr. Windigate, of the Alpha, and by him to his club, of which Mr. Henry Baker is a member.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Oh, sir, you are the very man whom I have longed to meet,” cried the little fellow with outstretched hands and quivering fingers.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “I can hardly explain to you how interested I am in this matter.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes hailed a four-wheeler which was passing.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “In that case we had better discuss it in a cosy room rather than in this wind-swept market-place,” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “But pray tell me, before we go farther, who it is that I have the pleasure of assisting.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: The man hesitated for an instant.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “My name is John Robinson,” he answered with a sidelong glance.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “No, no; the real name,” said Holmes sweetly.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “It is always awkward doing business with an alias.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: A flush sprang to the white cheeks of the stranger.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Well then,” said he, “my real name is James Ryder.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: “Precisely so. Head attendant at the Hotel Cosmopolitan.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Pray step into the cab, and I shall soon be able to tell you everything which you would wish to know.”
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: The little man stood glancing from one to the other of us with half-frightened, half-hopeful eyes, as one who is not sure whether he is on the verge of a windfall or of a catastrophe.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime market, produce stall, gas lamps

segment_text: Then he stepped into the cab, and in half an hour we were back in the sitting-room at Baker Street.
scene_description: indoors, cab interior, dark upholstery, passing streetlights

segment_text: Nothing had been said during our drive, but the high, thin breathing of our new companion, and the claspings and unclaspings of his hands, spoke of the nervous tension within him.
scene_description: indoors, cab interior, dark upholstery, passing streetlights

segment_text: “Here we are!” said Holmes cheerily as we filed into the room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The fire looks very seasonable in this weather. You look cold, Mr. Ryder.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Pray take the basket-chair. I will just put on my slippers before we settle this little matter of yours.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Now, then! You want to know what became of those geese?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, sir.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Or rather, I fancy, of that goose. It was one bird, I imagine in which you were interested—white, with a black bar across the tail.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ryder quivered with emotion.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Oh, sir,” he cried, “can you tell me where it went to?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It came here.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Here?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Yes, and a most remarkable bird it proved. I don’t wonder that you should take an interest in it.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It laid an egg after it was dead—the bonniest, brightest little blue egg that ever was seen. I have it here in my museum.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Our visitor staggered to his feet and clutched the mantelpiece with his right hand.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Holmes unlocked his strong-box and held up the blue carbuncle, which shone out like a star, with a cold, brilliant, many-pointed radiance.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ryder stood glaring with a drawn face, uncertain whether to claim or to disown it.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “The game’s up, Ryder,” said Holmes quietly.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Hold up, man, or you’ll be into the fire! Give him an arm back into his chair, Watson.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: He’s not got blood enough to go in for felony with impunity. Give him a dash of brandy. So!
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Now he looks a little more human. What a shrimp it is, to be sure!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: For a moment he had staggered and nearly fallen, but the brandy brought a tinge of colour into his cheeks, and he sat staring with frightened eyes at his accuser.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I have almost every link in my hands, and all the proofs which I could possibly need, so there is little which you need tell me.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Still, that little may as well be cleared up to make the case complete. You had heard, Ryder, of this blue stone of the Countess of Morcar’s?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It was Catherine Cusack who told me of it,” said he in a crackling voice.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I see—her ladyship’s waiting-maid. Well, the temptation of sudden wealth so easily acquired was too much for you, as it has been for better men before you; but you were not very scrupulous in the means you used.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: It seems to me, Ryder, that there is the making of a very pretty villain in you. You knew that this man Horner, the plumber, had been concerned in some such matter before, and that suspicion would rest the more readily upon him.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: What did you do, then? You made some small job in my lady’s room—you and your confederate Cusack—and you managed that he should be the man sent for.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then, when he had left, you rifled the jewel-case, raised the alarm, and had this unfortunate man arrested. You then—”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ryder threw himself down suddenly upon the rug and clutched at my companion’s knees.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “For God’s sake, have mercy!” he shrieked.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Think of my father! Of my mother! It would break their hearts.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I never went wrong before! I never will again. I swear it.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I’ll swear it on a Bible. Oh, don’t bring it into court!
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: For Christ’s sake, don’t!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Get back into your chair!” said Holmes sternly.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “It is very well to cringe and crawl now, but you thought little enough of this poor Horner in the dock for a crime of which he knew nothing.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I will fly, Mr. Holmes. I will leave the country, sir.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then the charge against him will break down.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Hum! We will talk about that.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: And now let us hear a true account of the next act. How came the stone into the goose, and how came the goose into the open market?
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Tell us the truth, for there lies your only hope of safety.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Ryder passed his tongue over his parched lips.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “I will tell you it just as it happened, sir,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “When Horner had been arrested, it seemed to me that it would be best for me to get away with the stone at once, for I did not know at what moment the police might not take it into their heads to search me and my room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: There was no place about the hotel where it would be safe.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I went out, as if on some commission, and I made for my sister’s house.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: She had married a man named Oakshott, and lived in Brixton Road, where she fattened fowls for the market.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: All the way there every man I met seemed to me to be a policeman or a detective; and, for all that it was a cold night, the sweat was pouring down my face before I came to the Brixton Road.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: My sister asked me what was the matter, and why I was so pale; but I told her that I had been upset by the jewel robbery at the hotel.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: Then I went into the back yard and smoked a pipe and wondered what it would be best to do.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “I had a friend once called Maudsley, who went to the bad, and has just been serving his time in Pentonville.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: One day he had met me, and fell into talk about the ways of thieves, and how they could get rid of what they stole.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: I knew that he would be true to me, for I knew one or two things about him; so I made up my mind to go right on to Kilburn, where he lived, and take him into my confidence.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: He would show me how to turn the stone into money. But how to get to him in safety?
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: I thought of the agonies I had gone through in coming from the hotel. I might at any moment be seized and searched, and there would be the stone in my waistcoat pocket.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: I was leaning against the wall at the time and looking at the geese which were waddling about round my feet, and suddenly an idea came into my head which showed me how I could beat the best detective that ever lived.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “My sister had told me some weeks before that I might have the pick of her geese for a Christmas present, and I knew that she was always as good as her word.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: I would take my goose now, and in it I would carry my stone to Kilburn.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: There was a little shed in the yard, and behind this I drove one of the birds—a fine big one, white, with a barred tail.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: I caught it, and prying its bill open, I thrust the stone down its throat as far as my finger could reach.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: The bird gave a gulp, and I felt the stone pass along its gullet and down into its crop.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: But the creature flapped and struggled, and out came my sister to know what was the matter.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: As I turned to speak to her the brute broke loose and fluttered off among the others.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Whatever were you doing with that bird, Jem?’ says she.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Well,’ said I, ‘you said you’d give me one for Christmas, and I was feeling which was the fattest.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Oh,’ says she, ‘we’ve set yours aside for you—Jem’s bird, we call it. It’s the big white one over yonder.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: There’s twenty-six of them, which makes one for you, and one for us, and two dozen for the market.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Thank you, Maggie,’ says I; ‘but if it is all the same to you, I’d rather have that one I was handling just now.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘The other is a good three pound heavier,’ said she, ‘and we fattened it expressly for you.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Never mind. I’ll have the other, and I’ll take it now,’ said I.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Oh, just as you like,’ said she, a little huffed. ‘Which is it you want, then?’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘That white one with the barred tail, right in the middle of the flock.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Oh, very well. Kill it and take it with you.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “Well, I did what she said, Mr. Holmes, and I carried the bird all the way to Kilburn.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: I told my pal what I had done, for he was a man that it was easy to tell a thing like that to.
scene_description: indoors, dim room, wooden table, scattered feathers

segment_text: He laughed until he choked, and we got a knife and opened the goose.
scene_description: indoors, dim room, wooden table, scattered feathers

segment_text: My heart turned to water, for there was no sign of the stone, and I knew that some terrible mistake had occurred.
scene_description: indoors, dim room, wooden table, scattered feathers

segment_text: I left the bird, rushed back to my sister’s, and hurried into the back yard.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: There was not a bird to be seen there.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Where are they all, Maggie?’ I cried.
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Gone to the dealer’s, Jem.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Which dealer’s?’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Breckinridge, of Covent Garden.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘But was there another with a barred tail?’ I asked, ‘the same as the one I chose?’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “‘Yes, Jem; there were two barred-tailed ones, and I could never tell them apart.’
scene_description: outdoors, nighttime backyard, poultry enclosure, small shed

segment_text: “Well, then, of course I saw it all, and I ran off as hard as my feet would carry me to this man Breckinridge; but he had sold the lot at once, and not one word would he tell me as to where they had gone.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian city streets, cold air, distant lights

segment_text: You heard him yourselves to-night. Well, he has always answered me like that.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: My sister thinks that I am going mad. Sometimes I think that I am myself.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: And now—and now I am myself a branded thief, without ever having touched the wealth for which I sold my character. God help me!
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: God help me!” He burst into convulsive sobbing, with his face buried in his hands.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: There was a long silence, broken only by his heavy breathing and by the measured tapping of Sherlock Holmes’ finger-tips upon the edge of the table.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Then my friend rose and threw open the door.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “Get out!” said he.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “What, sir! Oh, Heaven bless you!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “No more words. Get out!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: And no more words were needed. There was a rush, a clatter upon the stairs, the bang of a door, and the crisp rattle of running footfalls from the street.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: “After all, Watson,” said Holmes, reaching up his hand for his clay pipe, “I am not retained by the police to supply their deficiencies.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: If Horner were in danger it would be another thing; but this fellow will not appear against him, and the case must collapse.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: I suppose that I am commuting a felony, but it is just possible that I am saving a soul. This fellow will not go wrong again; he is too terribly frightened.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Send him to gaol now, and you make him a gaol-bird for life. Besides, it is the season of forgiveness.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: Chance has put in our way a most singular and whimsical problem, and its solution is its own reward.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers

segment_text: If you will have the goodness to touch the bell, Doctor, we will begin another investigation, in which, also a bird will be the chief feature.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian living room, fireplace, cluttered papers
